document.docAuthor: Binoy, C., Kumar, P. Girish & Santhosh, S.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Indian Dasyproctus Lepeletier & Brullé 1835 (Hymenoptera Crabronidae) with description of four new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dasyproctus geethae Binoy & Girish Kumar, 2021: 224
(28 Jan.) ( India : Kerala ).

Dasyproctus hainanensis
Yue & Li, 2021: 25
in
Yue et al. 2021
(18 Mar.) ( China : Hainan ) (syn. nov.).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Justification of new synonymy.
D. hainanensis Yue & Li, 2021
(18 March ) described from Hainan Province of China (
Yue et al. 2021
) falls within the individual variation of
D. geethae Binoy & Girish Kumar, 2021
(28 January ) and is hereby synonymised.

Diagnosis. Clypeus with two well-produced lobes apico-medially and pointed lateral process, without median indentations; IOC distinct; POD almost equal to OOD; anterior carina of pronotal collar laterally curving towards pronotal lobe; marked punctation on head, mesosoma , metasoma and mesopleuron; all metasomal terga with yellow maculae.
Description. Female . ( Figs 33– 40 ). Body length 9.72–9.90 mm ; fore wing length 7.11–7.18 mm .

Clypeus apico-medially produced into two well-defined lobes, pointed lateral process present ( Fig. 36 ); punctation of head, mesosoma and metasoma conspicuous; conspicuous IOC dividing frons, followed by regular, concave and vaguely foveolate excavation ( Fig. 35 ); well-imprinted supra-orbital fossa; punctation of mesopleuron similar to that of head, mesosoma and metasoma; POD almost equal to OOD ( Fig. 34 ); Gt 1 robust, length distinctly less than 2 × its greatest width, 1.4 × length of Gt 2; black with following parts variously coloured: scape yellow; mandible yellow with apex reddish brown; pronotal collar (except median notch), pronotal lobe and prepectus yellow; axilla and two almost contiguous spots on anterior half of scutellum yellow ( Fig. 37 ); Gt 2 with elongated and similar maculae of Gt 3 and Gt 4 ( Fig. 40 ).

Male
. ( Figs 41–46 ). Body length 5.47–5.81 mm ; fore wing length 3.46–3.81 mm .

Clypeus apico-medially produced, slightly bilobed ( Fig. 44 ); POD almost equal to OOD ( Fig. 42 ); Gt 2 finely punctured; head, mesosoma and Gt 1 distinctly punctate; pronotum with distinct rugae anterior to collar; black with following variously coloured parts: scape yellow; mandible black; pronotal collar (except medially), pronotal lobe and prepectus yellow; axilla and two almost contiguous spots on anterior half of scutellum yellow ( Fig. 45 ); Gt 2– Gt 6 maculated ( Fig. 46 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 33–40.
Dasyproctus geethae Binoy & Girish Kumar
Holotype ♀. 33. Habitus, lateral view; 34. Head, dorsal view; 35. Head, frontal view; 36. Clypeus; 37. Mesosoma , dorsal view; 38. Mesosoma , lateral view; 39. Gt 1 , Gt 2 & Gt 3 , dorsal view; 40. Metasoma, lateral view.

FIGURES 41–46.
Dasyproctus geethae Binoy & Girish Kumar
Paratype ♂. 41. Habitus, lateral view; 42. Head, dorsal view; 43. Head, frontal view; 44. Clypeus; 45. Mesosoma , dorsal view; 46. Metasoma, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Prey. Adult Diptera belonging to families Dolichopodidae , Hybotidae , Lauxaniidae and
Stratiomyidae (
Binoy et al. 2021
)
.
